title: Lenovo Legion Go
content:
{{Short description|2023 handheld gaming computer by Lenovo}}
'''Lenovo Legion Go''' is a handheld gaming device and personal computer developed by [[Lenovo]] and released in October 2023. It has an 8.8 inch touch screen. Its CPU is an [[Ryzen|AMD Ryzen]] Z1 APU chipset with RDNA integrated graphics. It has 16GB of 7500Mhz LPDDR5X RAM and 512GB of PCIe Gen4 SSD storage, and a 49.2-watt-hour battery, which is comparably larger than the [[Steam Deck]]. It is competing with its ROG ally, the [[Nintendo Switch]]. It costs US$700<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.wired.com/review/lenovo-legion-go/ |title=Archived copy |access-date=2023-11-24 |archive-date=2023-11-23 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231123213735/https://www.wired.com/review/lenovo-legion-go/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.amd.com/en/gaming/handhelds/lenovo-legion-go.html |title=Archived copy |access-date=2023-11-24 |archive-date=2023-11-24 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231124135420/https://www.amd.com/en/gaming/handhelds/lenovo-legion-go.html |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/the-lenovo-legion-go-a-switch-like-windows-handheld-is-now-available/1100-6517422/ |title=Archived copy |access-date=2023-11-24 |archive-date=2023-11-20 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231120220245/https://www.gamespot.com/articles/the-lenovo-legion-go-a-switch-like-windows-handheld-is-now-available/1100-6517422/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://gizmodo.com/hands-on-lenovo-legion-go-1850794888 |title=Archived copy |access-date=2023-11-24 |archive-date=2023-11-24 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231124034834/https://gizmodo.com/hands-on-lenovo-legion-go-1850794888 |url-status=live }}</ref>

The device uses [[Windows 11]] with a Lenovo Space game launcher.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.makeuseof.com/ifa-2023-features-we-loved-new-lenovo-legion-go/ |title=Archived copy |access-date=2023-11-24 |archive-date=2023-09-30 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230930033355/https://www.makeuseof.com/ifa-2023-features-we-loved-new-lenovo-legion-go/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/gaming/lenovo-legion-go-fantastic--31228221|title=Will the Lenovo Legion Go take over the handheld market – Probably not|first=Jasmine|last=Mannan|date=October 19, 2023|website=The Mirror}}</ref>

==Technology==

The display is a QHD+ screen with a 2560×1600 resolution, 16:10 ratio, 144 Hz and 500 nits.
There is an accessory line-up for the product, including VR glasses, [[surround sound]] wired headphones and a backpack. It is supplied with a carrying case, a [[AC adapter|power adapter]], a controller base‌ and an [[Xbox Game Pass]].<ref>https://psref.lenovo.com/syspool/Sys/PDF/Legion/Legion_Go_8APU1/Legion_Go_8APU1_Spec.pdf</ref> It weighs 854 g with controllers and 650 g without them. Its cooling component features a [[liquid-crystal polymer]] 79-blade fan.

==Reception==
Gizmodo wrote that because of the [[Windows 11]] software and the size of the handheld, it is at a disadvantage. He called it bulky and unwieldy.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://gizmodo.com/lenovo-legion-go-performance-display-battery-1851012835|title=Legion Go Review: Innovative and Powerful, but Bulky and Unwieldy|date=November 13, 2023|website=Gizmodo}}</ref>
